greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of nonnegative integers: a(0) = 0, a(1) = 1, a(2n) = A117968(a(n)), a(2n+1) = A117967(1+a(n)).
comment: This is an instance of entanglement permutation, where complementary pair A005843/A005408 (even and odd numbers respectively) is entangled with complementary pair A117968/A117967 (negative and positive part of inverse of balanced ternary enumeration of integers, respectively), with a(0) set to 0 and a(1) set to 1.
Thus this shares with A140263 the property that after a(0)=0, the even positions contain only terms of A117968 and the odd positions contain only terms of A117967.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Antti Karttunen, Pin & logarithmic scatter plots computed for range 0..2047 only (computed with OEIS "graph" command)
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
program: (Scheme, with memoizing definec-macro from _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library)
def a004488(n): return int("".join([str((3 - i)%3) for i in digits(n, 3)[1:]]), 3)
def a117967(n): return 0 if n==0 else a117968(-n) if n<0 else a004488(a117968(n))
def a(n): return n if n<2 else a117968(a(n/2)) if n%2==0 else a117967(1 + a((n - 1)/2)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 07 2017
xref: Related permutations: A140263, A054429, A246209, A246211.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 19 2014
